DOCNAME: MEIER AND GRAFOVA v. THE CZECH REPUBLIC
JUDGES: Javier Borrego Borrego;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Snejana Botoucharova
TEXT: The applicants , Mr PERSON and PERSON , are NORP nationals who were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE and GPE respectively . They were represented before the ORG by Mr J. Kalista , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON , from ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
In DATE a GPE company having belonged to the applicants’ family was nationalised .

On DATE the first applicant made a request to the company and ORG and its Privatisation ( GPE pro správu národního majetku a jeho privatizaci ) under LAW for restitution of the company which , according to him , had been nationalised contrary to the law then in force . He claimed restitution on his behalf and on behalf of the second applicant , who had originally owned CARDINAL of the property , and CARDINAL successors in title to the other original co - owners .
As the company apparently refused to restore the property , the first applicant brought an action in the GPE CARDINAL ORG ( okresní soud ) for its recovery .
On DATE , ORG granted the restitution action .

On DATE ORG ( městský soud ) quashed the judgment and remitted the case to ORG which , on DATE , dismissed the restitution action , finding that the first applicant had not proved that the property had been unlawfully nationalised .
On DATE ORG upheld this judgment .
On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) rejected the first applicant ’s appeal on points of law ( dovolání ) .

On DATE ORG ( GPE PERSON ) quashed ORG judgment , finding that the company had been nationalised contrary to Presidential Decree no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL and , therefore , should be restored under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(k ) of the Extra - Judicial Rehabilitation Act .

On DATE , ORG , being bound by the legal opinion of ORG , granted the restitution action , ordering the company to conclude a restitution agreement with the first applicant . On DATE ORG upheld this judgment in respect of the CARDINAL fourths of the property , modifying it in respect of the remaining fourth which had belonged to the second applicant .
ORG quashed ORG judgment in respect of the above fourth of the property and , at the same time , quashed the relevant part of ORG judgment of DATE .

On DATE ORG dismissed the remainder of the restitution action , holding that the second applicant was the only person who was entitled to seek restitution of the outstanding fourth of the property and , therefore , could not validly assign her restitution entitlement to the first applicant .
On DATE ORG , upheld the operative part of this judgment with certain modifications to the reasoning .
On DATE ORG dismissed the first applicant ’s constitutional appeal .

The relevant domestic law and practice concerning remedies for the excessive length of judicial proceedings are stated in the ORG ’s decision in the case of PERSON v. GPE , no . MONEY ( dec . ) , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL , DATE ) .
